page.title: 06OADBY RETIRED KNITTERS HOMES
page.content: The{Framework Knitters'Cottage Homes were founded by the{Worshipful Company of{Framework Knitters.}They were moved to Stoughton Road,Oadby in 1909.{In {June 1985 there were 36 residents. Each cottage is named after a bene- factor of the homes,e.g.,a hosiery manufacturer such as{Corah or Byford. Each year,a member of the{Worshipful {Company}acts as Master of the homes. Applicants for places in the homes must be{retired hosiery workers, medically fit and able to look after themselves. They must agree to be on good terms with other residents. A {hall}for{social meetings,car parks}and {allotments}are provided. A full time warden is employed. The residents were very happy. Those coming from inner city areas enjoyed the range of organised activities. They felt able to preserve their independence.
